message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using survey data from the World Bank's LSMS-ISA program, we find that households with greater access to credit have higher income and can invest more in their businesses.", "dataset": ["World Bank's LSMS-ISA"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This research utilizes satellite data from NASA's MODIS instrument to examine the relationship between vegetation productivity and climate variability in the Sahel region of Africa.", "dataset": ["NASA's MODIS"], "topic": ["Environment", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze two datasets: the Global Financial Inclusion Database (Findex) and the World Development Indicators (WDI), to estimate the impact of financial inclusion on poverty reduction in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Global Financial Inclusion Database (Findex)", "World Development Indicators (WDI)"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses time-series data on exchange rates from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and investigates the role of currency fluctuations on international trade in East Asian economies.", "dataset": ["International Monetary Fund (IMF)"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We leverage household surveys from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to explore the patterns of nutritional outcomes among children in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines the effect of infrastructure investment on economic growth using dataset from the World Bank's Private Participation in Infrastructure Project (PPI).", "dataset": ["World Bank's Private Participation in Infrastructure Project (PPI)"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the International Energy Agency (IEA) and the United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) to analyze the effects of energy access on manufacturing productivity in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency (IEA)", "United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO)"], "topic": ["Energy", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Food and Agriculture Organization's (FAO) Global Forest Resources Assessment, we investigate the drivers and consequences of deforestation in Southeast Asia.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization's (FAO) Global Forest Resources Assessment"], "topic": ["Environment", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines data on education attainment from the World Bank's Education Statistics database and labor market outcomes from the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS) to examine the impact of education on earnings inequality across countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Education Statistics database", "Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS)"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze complementary datasets on road infrastructure quality from the African Development Bank's (AfDB) Road Transport Program and mobile phone network coverage from GSMA Intelligence, to evaluate the impact of roads and connectivity on poverty reduction in rural areas.", "dataset": ["African Development Bank's (AfDB) Road Transport Program", "GSMA Intelligence"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Financial Inclusion"]}]
